SEARCH
Module org.microbean.bean
Package org.microbean.bean

Class AbstractInstantiator<R,I>

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.bean.AbstractInstantiator<R,I>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Instantiator<I>
public abstract class AbstractInstantiator<R,I> extends Object implements Instantiator<I>
An abstract Instantiator implementation that is capable of performing dependency resolution.
Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
  • instantiate()

    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction
    A functional interface that returns a suitable Creation given a zero-based position (such as that of a method or constructor parameter).

    • AbstractInstantiator

      protected AbstractInstantiator(IntFunction<?> df)
      Creates a new AbstractInstantiator implementation (convenience constructor).
      Parameters:
      df - an IntFunction that accepts a zero-based position (such as that of a method or constructor parameter) and returns a (possibly null) resolved dependency suitable for that position; may be null
      See Also:
      • AbstractInstantiator(Supplier, IntFunction)

    • AbstractInstantiator

      protected AbstractInstantiator(R receiver, IntFunction<?> df)
      Creates a new AbstractInstantiator implementation (convenience constructor).
      Parameters:
      receiver - a receiver whose instance method (or similar) will be used to instantiate the product; may be null if such a receiver is not needed
      df - an IntFunction that accepts a zero-based position (such as that of a method or constructor parameter) and returns a (possibly null) resolved dependency suitable for that position; may be null
      See Also:
      • AbstractInstantiator(Supplier, IntFunction)

    • AbstractInstantiator

      protected AbstractInstantiator(Supplier<? extends R> rs, IntFunction<?> df)
      Creates a new AbstractInstantiator implementation (preferred constructor).
      Parameters:
      rs - a Supplier of a receiver whose instance method (or similar) will be used to instantiate the product; may be null if such a receiver is not needed
      df - an IntFunction that accepts a zero-based position (such as that of a method or constructor parameter) and returns a (possibly null) resolved dependency suitable for that position; may be null

    • AbstractInstantiator

      protected AbstractInstantiator(Creation<?> c, Collection<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> bscs, ReferenceSelector rs)
      Creates a new AbstractInstantiator implementation (convenience constructor).
      Parameters:
      c - a Creation; may be null
      bscs - a Collection of BeanSelectionCriteria that will be used to resolve required dependencies; may be null if there are no dependencies required for the instantiation mechanism
      rs - a ReferenceSelector; may be null if beanClassSelectionCriteria is null and there are no dependencies to resolve
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - in certain cases if rs is null
      See Also:
      • AbstractInstantiator(BeanSelectionCriteria, Creation, IntFunction, PositionalCreationBiFunction, ReferenceSelector)

    • AbstractInstantiator

      protected AbstractInstantiator(Creation<?> c, Collection<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> bscs, AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction pcbf, ReferenceSelector rs)
      Creates a new AbstractInstantiator implementation (convenience constructor).
      Parameters:
      c - a Creation; may be null
      bscs - a Collection of BeanSelectionCriteria that will be used to resolve required dependencies; may be null if there are no dependencies required for the instantiation mechanism
      pcbf - a AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction that supplies a Creation given an initial Creation and a zero-based position (such as that of a method or constructor parameter); may be null; the first argument supplied to this AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction will be c
      rs - a ReferenceSelector; may be null if beanClassSelectionCriteria is null and there are no dependencies to resolve
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - in certain cases if rs is null
      See Also:
      • AbstractInstantiator(BeanSelectionCriteria, Creation, IntFunction, PositionalCreationBiFunction, ReferenceSelector)

    • AbstractInstantiator

      protected AbstractInstantiator(BeanSelectionCriteria beanClassSelectionCriteria, Creation<?> c, Collection<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> bscs, int[] zeroBasedPositions, AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction pcbf, ReferenceSelector rs)
      Creates a new AbstractInstantiator implementation (convenience constructor).
      Parameters:
      beanClassSelectionCriteria - a BeanSelectionCriteria that can select the receiver whose instance method (or similar) will be used to instantiate the product; may be null if such a receiver is not needed
      c - a Creation; may be null
      bscs - a Collection of BeanSelectionCriteria that will be used to resolve required dependencies; may be null if there are no dependencies required for the instantiation mechanism
      zeroBasedPositions - an even-length array of ints whose even-indexed elements are "positions" (such as of parameters of a method or constructor) and whose odd-indexed elements are corresponding indices into a List formed from the supplied bscs Collection; the array thus serves as a kind of map; may be null
      pcbf - a AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction that supplies a Creation given an initial Creation and a zero-based position (such as that of a method or constructor parameter); may be null; the first argument supplied to this AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction will be c
      rs - a ReferenceSelector; may be null if beanClassSelectionCriteria is null and there are no dependencies to resolve
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - in certain cases if rs is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if zeroBasedPositions is not empty and bscs is empty, or if zeroBasedPositions is empty and bscs is not empty, or if the length of the int array is greater than the size of the bscs Collection
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if zeroBasedPositions contains an int that is less than 0
      See Also:
      • AbstractInstantiator(BeanSelectionCriteria, Creation, IntFunction, PositionalCreationBiFunction, ReferenceSelector)

    • AbstractInstantiator

      protected AbstractInstantiator(BeanSelectionCriteria beanClassSelectionCriteria, Creation<?> c, IntFunction<? extends BeanSelectionCriteria> f, AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction pcbf, ReferenceSelector rs)
      Creates a new AbstractInstantiator implementation (preferred constructor).
      Parameters:
      beanClassSelectionCriteria - a BeanSelectionCriteria that can select the receiver whose instance method (or similar) will be used to instantiate the product; may be null if such a receiver is not needed
      c - a Creation; may be null
      f - an IntFunction that accepts a zero-based position (such as that of a method or constructor parameter) and returns a (possibly null BeanSelectionCriteria corresponding to that position; may be null if there are no dependencies to be resolved
      pcbf - a AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction that supplies a Creation given an initial Creation and a zero-based position (such as that of a method or constructor parameter); may be null; the first argument supplied to this AbstractInstantiator.PositionalCreationBiFunction will be c
      rs - a ReferenceSelector; may be null if beanClassSelectionCriteria is null and there are no dependencies to resolve
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - in certain cases if rs is null

  • Method Details

    • instantiate

      public final I instantiate()
      Instantiates the product and returns it.
      Specified by:
      instantiate in interface Instantiator<R>
      Returns:
      the result of instantiation; never null
      See Also:
      • instantiate(Object, IntFunction)

    • instantiate

      protected abstract I instantiate(R r, IntFunction<?> f)
      Instantiates the product and returns it, possibly using the supplied receiver and dependency resolver function.

      Implementations of this method must not return null.

      This method is invoked by the instantiate() method. Implementations of this method must not call instantiate() or an infinite loop may result.

      Parameters:
      r - a receiver on which an instance method may be invoked, if that is the means of instantiation; may be null if no such receiver is required or could be located
      f - an IntFunction that, given a zero-based position (such as that of a method or constructor parameter), returns a resolved depdencency suitable for that location, or null; must not be null
      Returns:
      the product; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if f is null
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if f is supplied with a negative int as its second argument
